THE CATHOLIC EPISTLES.

THOUGH the word καθολική does not form part of the Title of the Epistle of 81. James in any of the older MSS„ yet the fact that this Epistle was included from an early period in the collec- tion known as the Catholic Epistles, which followed the Acts and preceded the Epistles of 81. Paul, seems to call for a short note on the history and meaning of the term.

Eusebius is the first to mention the fact in the words τοιαῦτα τὰ κατὰ τὸν Ἰάκωβον, οὗ ἡ πρώτη τῶν ὀνομαζομένων καθολικῶν ἐπιστολῶν εἶναι λέγεται (ΗΕ. ii. 23), and we find the same asserted in the Catalogues of the Canonical Books ratified by the Councils of Laodicea and of Carthage, as well as in the lists given by Cyril of Jerusalem, Athanasius, Gregory Nazianzen, and Am- philochius before the end of the fourth century.l Earlier uses of the term may be found in Clement of Alexandria (Strom. iv. 15, p.
